thread.title: Does It Still Djent? Here's What Meshuggah Would Sound Like If They Tuned Up A Whole Octave [News]
thread.title_full: Does It Still Djent? Here's What Meshuggah Would Sound Like If They Tuned Up A Whole Octave [News]

title: Does It Still Djent? Here's What Meshuggah Would Sound Like If They Tuned Up A Whole Octave [News]
text:
Does It Still Djent? Here's What Meshuggah Would Sound Like If They Tuned Up a Whole Octave A whole octave up compared to their regular tuning, that is. Posted 12 hours ago 4 
Pete Cottrell from YouTube recently joined forces with Andrew Baena from YouTube for an interesting experiment - uptuned Meshuggah. 
The boys essentially took Meshuggah stuff and played them a whole octave higher than the band does. 
You can check it all out in the embedded video player below. 17 days ago in Music news , 4 comments 1 a month ago in Music news , 11 comments 10 a month ago in Music news , 42 comments Trending stories 14 hours ago in Features , 32 comments 12 18 hours ago in Music news , 27 comments 28 24 comments sorted by best / new / date Post a comment meh about the same... djent would be alright if it wasn't so repetitive. Makes the music far too boring to hold interest. 8 I hope you listen to blues to make your comment ironic af. 3 m4ss3 m/ 80 · 6 hours ago · permalink · ↑ reply Think of it more in the vein of Steve Reich, or other 'minimalist' music - just with way more mixing done. Not excusing all the shitty duhjent out there, of course! But when I get bored of it, it helps to reframe my perspective. 0 oizys93 10 · 7 hours ago · permalink · ↑ reply Nothing against djent as a whole I realize with every genre there will be awesomeness and garbage. My problem is they can djent and switch it up a little. make multiple djent style riffs. No need to use the same one throughout the entirety of the whole song. Especially when it's the main riff. m4ss3 m/ I listen to all forms of music with the exception of opera and 99% of rap. 0 Meshuggah still sounds fantastic. As is to be expected. 4 Meshuggah actually never djented dude. 1 From what I understand they invented it 1 To this day it bugs me that people still refer to Meshuggah as djent. It bugs me even more that people are still debating it. 0 there progressive metal, always have been and always will, none of this djent bollocks 1 Still don't know what djent is 1 Of course it sounds good, it's all about the rhythmic play. The actual pitches are secondary. 1 Well, of course it doesn't "djent", because nothing " djents". Meshuggah are an overrated numetal band that okay in odd time signatures for odd time signatures sake, not a musical genre. 0 Anjohl 450 · 4 hours ago · permalink · ↑ reply If numetal is a genre and djent isn't then color me confused. You can see clear stylistic themes through songs and bands referred to as djent, namely the use of diverse time signatures and a focus on rhythmic playing. You may not like it or enjoy it, but that doesn't mean it isn't a genre. This is coming from someone who hated the term djent until recently when I learned that, yes, it does actually apply to a pretty specific thing. 0 A Messuggah preview without Bleed. I'm fcukin outta here, nothing to see... 1 This is what makes tosin abasi cry, cause he's not clever enough to come up with awesome ideas like thia 6 This, where is the goddamn edit button 2 I'm surprised this ad didn't address him as MR. Pete Cottrell 1
